channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: City held at home as Chelsea snatch stoppage‑time equaliser
item.description: Enzo Fernandez scores a stoppage-time equaliser as Chelsea end a tumultuous week by claiming a worthy Premier League point at title-chasing Manchester City.

item.title: Leeds denied win as Cunha hits back for Man Utd
item.description: Brenden Aaronson breaks the deadlock, before Matheus Cunha levels just three minutes later, as Leeds and Manchester United share the points at Elland road.

item.title: Second‑half lift sees Newcastle ease past Palace
item.description: Newcastle United climb to ninth in the table, as captain Bruno Guimaraes inspires the hosts to victory with a hard-fought win over Crystal Palace at St James' Park.

item.title: Reed's stoppage‑time strike earns Fulham dramatic draw with Liverpool
item.description: Harrison Reed's superb 97th-minute equaliser earns the hosts a dramatic point, cancelling out Cody Gakpo's goal from just three minutes earlier, as Fulham deny a Liverpool comeback in a Premier League thriller.

item.title: Brilliant Brobbey goal earns Sunderland late draw as Spurs booed
item.description: Sunderland increase the pressure on Tottenham Hotspur head coach Thomas Frank as Brian Brobbey's late equaliser gives the Black Cats a point.

item.title: Brentford surge past Everton with thrilling second‑half display
item.description: Igor Thiago scores a hat-trick to end his brief goal drought, as Brentford leapfrog Everton in the Premier League with a comfortable victory at the Hill Dickinson Stadium.

item.title: 'I'm here to be manager, not coach' - but will Amorim survive at Man Utd?
item.description: Ruben Amorim challenges Manchester United's board to let him do his job after Sunday's draw with Leeds, and says he intends to leave in 18 months' time.

item.title: 'Struggling Frank trapped in gilded cage at joyless Tottenham'
item.description: Struggling head coach Thomas Frank is trapped in a gilded cage at joyless Tottenham Hotspur, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: 'I was sure it was offside' - why did Wirtz equaliser stand?
item.description: Florian Wirtz thought his goal for Liverpool in the 2-2 draw at Fulham was offside - so how did technology allow it to stand?

item.title: Thelin 'accepts' Aberdeen sacking after winless run
item.description: Aberdeen sack manager Jimmy Thelin following a five-match winless run and just eight months on from the club's Scottish Cup win.

item.title: Leeds 'devastated' as fan dies at game with Man Utd
item.description: Leeds United say they are "devastated" after a supporter died before their Premier League game against Manchester United on Sunday.

item.title: 'Maybe you know better than me!' - Guardiola defends performance
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says how his side defended and played outside the final third was "extraordinary" and disagrees with Man City having a lack of momentum after failing to secure a second goal in a 1-1 draw against managerless Chelsea at the Etihad.

item.title: I will do my job for 18 months and then we move on - Amorim
item.description: Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim says that in 18 months' time, when his contract is due to end, he will leave, repeatedly stating that he came to "manage" the club, not just to be a coach.

item.title: Real Madrid youngster Garcia scores hat-trick in place of Mbappe
item.description: Watch highlights as Real Madrid beat Real Betis 5-1, with 21-year-old striker Gonzalo Garcia, starting in place of the injured Kylian Mbappe, scoring a hat-trick.

item.title: Chelsea have shown character through manager changes - McFarlane
item.description: Interim manager Calum McFarlane credits the leaders in the Chelsea dressing room for the character they have shown through a tumultuous week which saw manager Enzo Maresca sacked.

item.title: Reed deserves credit for a moment of 'pure inspiration'- Silva
item.description: Fulham manager Marco Silva reacts to his team's 2-2 draw against Liverpool with Harrison Reed scoring a stunning 97th-minute equaliser in a moment of "pure inspiration".

item.title: 'It's not enough'- Slot frustrated with Fulham draw
item.description: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says "it's not enough" for his side to rely on late goals after a "frustrating" 2-2 draw against Fulham at Craven Cottage.

item.title: Rangers' Sterling charged over crash after Old Firm game
item.description: Police said no-one was injured in the incident and the defender will appear in court at a later date.

item.title: 'When has it ever been this bad?' - McCowan haunted by Celtic form
item.description: Luke McCowan asks "when has it ever been this bad?" in the wake of Celtic's 3-1 home defeat by Rangers on Saturday.

item.title: 'Special' Moore always stood out - Defoe
item.description: Former Ibrox forward Jermain Defoe played a role in Mikey Moore arriving at Ibrox.

item.title: Chelsea keep tabs on Tonali - Sunday's gossip
item.description: Sandro Tonali is on Chelsea's radar, Napoli continue to track Kobbie Mainoo, while Real Madrid remain interested in Rodri.

item.title: 'I love Cardiff' - Barry-Murphy cools Strasbourg talk
item.description: Cardiff City head coach Brian Barry-Murphy plays down speculation linking him to French club Strasbourg.

item.title: Spurs sign Chelsea's Hamano on loan until June
item.description: Tottenham complete the signing of Chelsea's Maika Hamano on loan until the end of the season.

item.title: Rice 'stretches himself to limit' before another 'masterclass'
item.description: How injury doubt Declan Rice "stretched himself to the very limit" to take Arsenal six points clear at the top of the Premier League.

item.title: 'Haunted Nancy detached from reality as Celtic's lights go out'
item.description: BBC Sport Scotland's chief sports writer dissects the outcome of Saturday's Old Firm defeat for Celtic.

item.title: Hull & Sheff Utd fixtures among 17 EFL games off
item.description: Hull's game against Watford becomes the latest English Football League fixture on Sunday to be postponed because of freezing conditions.

item.title: West Ham closing in on Juventus defender Cascarino
item.description: West Ham are hoping to complete a move for Juventus defender Estelle Cascarino in the January transfer window.

item.title: 'Shocking, pathetic and embarrassing' - can Nuno save West Ham?
item.description: For West Ham and Nuno Espirito Santo, the picture looks bleak. A hapless 3-0 defeat by bottom side Wolves on Saturday came as a stark reality check for the struggling Hammers.

item.title: Haverfordwest County owner completes Hamilton takeover
item.description: Cymru Premier club Haverfordwest County's owners complete a takeover of financially troubled Hamilton Academical.

item.title: Six points clear but still 'more to come' from Hearts
item.description: After Hearts battled past Livingston to move six points clear at the top of the Scottish Premiership, manager Derek McInnes says there is 'more to come' as new players arrive.

item.title: 'I needed them and they were there' - when young players find new homes
item.description: BBC Sport explores how young footballers build bonds with second families when they leave home to sign for a new club on their path to the top.

item.title: Burnley lacked belief in defeat at Brighton - Parker
item.description: Burnley boss Scott Parker says his side "lacked belief" as they fall to their ninth defeat in 11 Premier League games at Brighton.

item.title: 'We are together with the board' - Nancy defiant after Celtic loss
item.description: Celtic manager Wilfried Nancy insists he is still "together with the board" and believes "we can turn things around" despite falling to a sixth loss in eight games following the derby defeat to Rangers.

item.title: How far can Askou's 'extremely ambitious' Motherwell go?
item.description: After backing up their "sexy" result against Celtic with victory over St Mirren, how far can this "extremely ambitious" Motherwell side go?

item.title: Beating Palace 'a big step forward' - Howe
item.description: Newcastle manager Eddie Howe says his team's 2-0 win over Crystal Palace represents "a big step forward", as The Magpies look to build momentum in their Premier League season.

item.title: Palace vulnerability to set-pieces a big issue - Glasner
item.description: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner criticises his side's inability to defend set-pieces after their 2-0 defeat at Newcastle United. Palace are without a win in seven games in all competitions.

item.title: Sometimes it just doesn't go your way - Frank
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur head coach Thomas Frank reacts to a frustrating draw at home against Sunderland, but says there are a lot of positives to take.

item.title: A tough match in tough conditions - Amorim
item.description: Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim says "it's hard to find a game where it is satisfying to draw" after their game at Leeds finished 1-1 but says his side played well in "a tough match in tough conditions".

item.title: Farke 'disappointed' with draw against Man Utd
item.description: Leeds manager Daniel Farke says he's "a bit disappointed" with a 1-1 draw against Manchester United, adding "it's not the best performance but good to take a point and move on".

item.title: Sutton's predictions v singer-songwriter & Newcastle fan Andrew Cushin
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on singer-songwriter & Newcastle fan Andrew Cushin - and AI - with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: 'Good idea' or taking 'massive chance' - is Rosenior ready for Chelsea?
item.description: Liam Rosenior is the leading candidate to become the Chelsea manager. BBC Sport looks at the reasons why.

item.title: 11 EFL players who could be on the move in January
item.description: BBC Sport examines some of the leading talent in the EFL likely to be subject to interest and offers over the January transfer window.

item.title: Hoban scores six in Glens win as Blues beat Bangor
item.description: Striker Pat Hoban scores six goals as a rampant Glentoran thump 10-man Carrick Rangers 7-0 at Taylors Avenue while there are also wins for Linfield and Crusaders in the Irish Premiership on Saturday.

item.title: 'A manager's dream' - why Rice is the perfect midfielder
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Alan Shearer and Jermain Defoe praise the performance of Declan Rice, who scored two goals in Arsenal's 3-2 win over Bournemouth.

item.title: Olmo's classy strike as Barcelona win tense derby
item.description: Barcelona move seven points clear at the top of La Liga after Dani Olmo and Robert Lewandowski strike late against Espanyol in the Catalan derby.

item.title: How Wolves teenager Mane picked apart West Ham
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer breaks down teenager Mateus Mane's unstoppable performance against West Ham at home.

item.title: How Villa's midfield trio dominated Forest
item.description: Match of the Day's Alan Shearer analyses the performance Aston Villa's Youri Tielemans, Boubacar Kamara and John McGinn as the Villans returned to form with a dominant 3-1 win over Nottingham Forest.

item.title: Rice and Gabriel character impresses Arteta
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta praises Gabriel Magalhaes and Declan Rice's mentality, and says Arsenal showed maturity in their 3-2 win against Bournemouth at Vitality Stadium.

item.title: What went wrong between Chelsea and Maresca?
item.description: Less than six months after guiding Chelsea to Club World Cup success, Enzo Maresca has left. But how did things unravel?

item.title: Who might be on move in January in WSL?
item.description: With the January transfer window opening in the Women's Super League, which players could be on the move and who is out of contract?

item.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this week
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

item.title: How does Maresca's Chelsea record compare?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore Enzo Maresca's records as Chelsea manager and how it compared to previous bosses.

item.title: The best wonderkids outside big five leagues
item.description: There are plenty of wonderkids catching the eye outside of Europe's big-five leagues - BBC Sport takes a look at the top 10 as ranked by the CIES Football Observatory research group.

item.title: Transfers - January 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: How is Premier League doing in race for five Champions League places?
item.description: With the top three in the Premier League pulling away, could fifth be enough for Champions League football again?

item.title: McFarlane to take on Guardiola - but who is he?
item.description: Chelsea Under-21 head coach Calum McFarlane is set to take charge of the Premier League trip to Manchester City.

item.title: Why is the Dundee derby not part of the 3pm blackout?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at why the Dundee derby is being shown on TV despite the 3pm blackout.

item.title: Who is Bendito Mantato? Man Utd debutant profiled
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Manchester United teenager Bendito Mantato, who made his senior debut against Wolves in United's final match of 2025

item.title: 'It's a mystery' - why Premier League teams haven't played every club yet
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Premier League teams have not played every opponent yet despite being at the midway point in the season.

item.title: Is a leg break worse than an ACL tear?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the different recovery periods for common football injuries.

item.title: Thelin's last interview as Aberdeen boss
item.description: Jimmy Thelin speaks publicly after his last interview as Aberdeen manager following their loss to Falkirk.

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: London City appoint Maestre as manager
item.description: Women's Super League side London City Lionesses have appointed Eder Maestre as manager following the sacking of Jocelyn Precheur.

item.title: Liverpool agree deal for midfielder Bergstrom
item.description: Liverpool agree a deal with Swedish side BK Hacken for midfielder Alice Bergstrom for an undisclosed fee.

item.title: Wilkinson hoping Fishlock will join Wales staff
item.description: Rhian Wilkinson hopes Jess Fishlock will join Wales' staff for the start of World Cup qualifying in March.

item.title: Wiegman gets honorary damehood in New Year Honours
item.description: Ice skaters Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean become a dame and knight in the New Year Honours list, while England women's manager Sarina Wiegman is made an honorary dame.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
